hyperCommons.heading: The Parametric Commons
hyperCommons.subtitle: A single .scad file doesn't define one object â€” it defines every possible object within its parameter space. We call these Bounded 4D Hyperobjects, and they're building a new kind of open infrastructure.
hyperCommons.whatIsBody: Traditional 3D files are static â€” one geometry, frozen at one size. A parametric hyperobject is a computational definition of an entire *family* of objects, bounded by the rules of its code. Change the parameters, and the geometry adapts â€” instantly.
hyperCommons.shiftFromDesc: One fixed geometry. One size. Download and hope it fits.
hyperCommons.shiftToDesc: Infinite geometries. Your dimensions. Configured to your reality.
hyperCommons.domainsSubtitle: From your desk drawer to disaster relief â€” parametric hyperobjects standardize the interfaces that let communities manufacture what they need.

cdg.heading: The Interfaces That Connect Everything
cdg.subtitle: CDG is the standardized geometry that ensures interoperability across the commons. Each CDG defines an immutable interface â€” the mathematical truth that lets hyperobjects from different creators work together.
cdg.explainerBody: Borrowed from aerospace lofting, CDG provides the geometric 'ground truth' that ensures a filter fits any bottle, a clip snaps onto any rail, and a socket connects to any prosthetic. Standardize the interface, and the community builds the rest.
